Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “With all the struggling I was doing, my attitude took a hit,” Kahlia said. “The more you witness yourself being down and out, the more you feel down and out, and the more stuck you feel.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Whenever L.A. city or county or Chicago or New York do something bold like this, it’s a really important signal that this big policy idea found its footing during COVID and represents a possible way forward in terms of supporting low income people across America,” Kline said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “If you knew the money was coming for three years, it’s a much longer runway. Can you go back to school? Can you quit your job now and look for a new one? Can you care for your aging parents?”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of the Stanford Basic Income Lab, which studies guaranteed income programs across the country

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Every six months, program participants and members in the control group receive the same survey questions about their wellbeing, financially and mentally, said Amy Castro, director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There is so much we don’t know yet,” Castro said. “We don’t know how long people need to receive cash to create what level of change.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: director of Penn’s Center for Guaranteed Income Research

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It’s taking me from always putting out fires to being able to actually make some moves to advance, not just being stuck,” Kahlia said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I didn’t expect to be accepted,” to the Breathe program, Kahlia said. “When I was, I was really, really pleasantly surprised. It definitely took the edge off.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Kahlia said she doesn’t keep track of how she spends the Breathe money.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I’m probably getting more comfortable with spending money,” she said. “Just learning to say yes to stuff. There’s some stuff that, at the beginning of the program I felt was, you know, almost extravagant. And now I’m like ‘Oh my god, I really needed that for my business to move forward.’”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The lab found, in general, that food and groceries are the top way participants are spending money, making up 35% of the funds spent. Retail sales and services are a close second at 31%.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: coach for program participants through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Participants also spent the money on transportation (10%) and housing and utilities (8%). They spend a smaller percentage on educational expenses, miscellaneous expenses and health care or medical expenses.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: coach for program participants through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Arredondo regularly checks in with about 300 participants.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: coach for program participants through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “People need help with normal, everyday interactions that may be easy for some individuals,” he said. “But for others, they don’t have any prior experience with them.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: coach for program participants through Wilmington-based Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It can’t just be the money,” Fournier said. “It’s the opportunity and the access to experiences sometimes that really make a big difference when there is even a little bit more resources folks can have. ”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: who oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: oversees the program coaches at Strength Based Community Change

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I haven’t gotten to the sexy part yet,” Kahlia said. “I had to get stronger and healthier, clear space, and lay a foundation first. Pulling yourself out of a hole often doesn’t look dramatic. For me it’s been the ability to do some fairly tedious stuff over an extended period of time, over and over again.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Long Beach guitarist used to tour the country with reggae artists

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: L.A. County’s Breathe program gives participants $1,000 monthly for three years, more money over a longer period than similar programs.
Last year, the program added an additional 200 participants who are former foster youth.
Researchers at the University of Pennsylvania are surveying the 1,000 Breathe participants, along with a control group of people not receiving funds.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: researchers at the University of Pennsylvania

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Stanford Guaranteed Income Lab tracks 31 pilot programs throughout the country, including the Breathe pilot.
Strength Based Community Change also offers workshops on financial literacy, investing and credit repair.
